He will use the loan money to purchase urea, herbicide and inputs for the naranjilla crops. With the loan from the community bank he will be able to increase the amount of sown land. He makes all his purchases in Guaranda. His dream is to create a natural products business. The challenges he faces are lack of communication and transport, bad climate and crop plagues. In his spare time, he likes to go to the beach with his wife and children.
He is very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase urea, herbicide, inputs for naranjilla crops.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad, se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer luchadora. Su familia es su pilar fundamental y la mayor motivación para ir en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades de vida. Casada y con cuatro hijos. Esta mujer aparte de realizar sus labores domésticas, también comercializa calzado. En un principio comenzó la actividad desde su casa, pero debido al incremento en el número de clientes se vio en la obligación de alquilar un local para la venta directa. Hoy lleva más de seis años trabajando en su negocio y cuenta que gracias a esto la calidad de vida en su hogar ha mejorado considerablemente.
Siente que el compartir los gastos con su esposo les ha permitido unirse como familia por lo cual se siente satisfecha y agradecida.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de calzado, con el fin de tener inventario para las celebraciones de semana santa. Espera que con esta inversión sus ventas aumenten y su calidad de vida siga mejorando.
texts.en:
María, age 52, is known for being a tenacious woman.  Her family is her fundamental pillar and her greatest motivation to seek better opportunities in life.  She is married and has four children.

In addition to the domestic work this woman does, she also sells shoes.  At the beginning she started her business activity from her house.  However, due to the increase is her customers, she saw the need to rent a place for direct sales.  She has now been working in her business for over six years.

Thanks to her business, the quality of life in her household has improved considerably.  She feels that sharing the expenses with her husband has allowed them to unite as a family.  This makes her feel satisfied and grateful.

She is now requesting a loan to buy shoes.  She will do this in order to have inventory for the Holy Week celebrations.  She hopes that her sales will increase with this investment and that the quality of her life continues to improve.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Gofurjon

texts.ru:
Гафурчон пришел в МДО «Арванд» чтобы получить кредит для увеличения поголовья скота. Он женат и имеет детей. Его вид деятельности заключается в том,что он занимается скотоводством. Этим делом Гафурчон занимается уже несколько лет. Каждый год его скот к весне увеличивался, но в прошлом году он начал строительство дома и продал часть своего скота. Сейчас, он недостаточно накопил свои средства, чтобы продолжить развивать свой бизнес, поэтому он обратился в Арванд.
 На полученный кредит Гафурчон хочет купить скот и дальше развивать свой бизнес. От полученных доходов он постепенно планируют заканчивать свою стройку.
texts.en: Gofurjon has approached MDO Arvand for a loan to increase his herd of cattle. He is married and has children. He earns his living in animal husbandry, and has been raising cattle for several years. Every spring, his herd would increase, but last year he began building a house, and so he sold some of his livestock. To date, he has not been able to save up enough money to continue developing his business, and this is why he has come to Arvand. Gofurjon wants purchase cattle to further develop his business. He plans to use the income generated by this loan to gradually finish the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en: Ms. Shakila is a 47-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for the past ten years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. Her goal is to increase revenues so that she may generate more income. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Fanny Dolores

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Fanny tiene una tienda en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00,  también los fines de semana ella y su esposo  venden carne en los días la feria y aprovechan para vender los productos de su tienda. Tiene este negocio por más de 20 años y es la forma como han sacado adelante su hogar de forma honrada a base de su trabajo. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne y  otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco hace tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante hasta que Dios lo permita.
texts.en:
The Junín Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This place is known for its friendly people. The best brandy in the province and all of Ecuador is distilled here.

Sra. Fanny lives in this place. She is 60 years old, married, and has a grown son who is independent. Her husband is a merchant.

Doña Fanny has a store in her home where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, and fruit. She works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. On the weekends, she and her husband sell meat at the fairs and also take advantage of this time to sell products from their store. Fanny has been in business for more than 20 years and her work enables her to make an honest living so that her household can move forward.

This loan will be used to buy more inventory for her store such as rice, sugar, oil, meat, and other basic necessities. Fanny has been with the Communal Bank for three years and enjoys the assistance she has received from the organization. Her dream is to continue moving forward as God allows.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, meat, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana es originaria de la bella ciudad Darío, cuna del gran poeta Rubén Darío, estado civil es unión de hecho, tiene un hijo en edad escolar el núcleo familiar está compuesto por tres personas.

Esta joven se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora y muy inteligente su profesión es técnica en contabilidad;
Se desempeña como secretaria de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace más de cuatro años.

solicita un crédito para gastos universitarios especialmente pagar el trámite de titulación en contabilidad.

Johana agradece a kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que le será de mucha importancia poder tramitar su titulo ya que con este documento tendrá más oportunidad de empleo con mejores condiciones salarial.
texts.en:
Johana was born in the beautiful city of Darío, birthplace of the great poet Rubén Darío. She lives in a free union and has a school-age son. Her family comprises three people. This young woman is hardworking and very intelligent. She is an accountant and has worked as a secretary in a water service and sewage company for more than four years. 

She has applied for a loan to pay her college degree fee in accounting. Johana thanks Kiva for its great support, which will allow her to receive her degree. Having this document will lead to more higher-paying job opportunities.

loans.use: to pay her college degree fee.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio. Este le permitirá comprar  variedad de ropa para niños y niña, damas; también para adquirir artículos para una pequeña tienda que posee.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar el inventario. Las condiciones económicas mejoraron  y desea siempre darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is asking for a new loan because she finds it necessary to invest more money in her business. This loan will allow her to buy a variety of boy’s, girl’s and women’s clothing and also items for the small store that she owns.
The last loan allowed her to increase her inventory. The economic conditions have improved and she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and items for her small store.

loans.name: Los Castreños Group

texts.es: Richard, quien aparece bajo la lámpara; es socio del Banco Comunal Los Castreños, que está ubicado en Castro, X Región. En este Banco Comunal se encuentran distintos rubros entre los cuales destacan los invernaderos, mini supermercado, almuerzos, empanadas, colectivos, repostería y banquetería. El negocio de Richard está vinculado a los invernadores y viveros. Él lo comenzó hace dos años, producto de falta de trabajo estable, quiso buscar una alternativa por cualquier problema, así que opto por hacer un invernadero y cultivar plantas, además de enraizar murtas, que son de exclusividad para hacer mermeladas. Los problemas que ha tenido que sobrellevar son básicamente el no poder contar con los recursos necesarios para cumplir sus sueños y tener más dinero para tener un bienestar tranquilo. El préstamo lo ocuparía en comprar insumos para tener más plantas y además agrandar en pequeño invernadero con el que cuenta. En el próximo ciclo está muy positivo y muy seguro de que le ira muy bien ya que su señora ha podido hacer negocios y  optar a trabajos seguros a futuro. De trabajar con Fondo Esperanza está muy contento y agradecido de aprender cosas nuevas y muy entusiasmado para poder seguir avanzando con los ciclos del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Richard, who is standing beneath the light, is a member of the Los Castreňos communal bank, which is in Castro, X Región.  There are different fields of work in this communal bank.  Among the different fields of work there are greenhouses, mini supermarket, lunches, empanadas, collectives, pastry making, and catering services.

Richard’s business has to do with greenhouses and nurseries.  He started it two years ago as a result of not having stable work.  He wanted to look for an alternative to any problem.  That is how he chose to make a greenhouse and cultivate plants.  He also grows murta berries, which are used exclusively to make marmalade.  

The problems that he has had to overcome are basically not being able to have the resources he needs to fulfill his dreams and needing more money in order to have a peaceful sense of well-being.

He will use the loan to buy supplies to have more plants and to enlarge his greenhouse.  He is very positive and very sure that the next cycle will go very well for him.  This is because his wife has been able to have businesses and choose secure jobs in the future.

He is very happy and grateful to work with Fondo Esperanza and to learn new things.  He is very enthusiastic about being able to continue progressing with the communal bank cycles.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his nursery and greenhouse.

loans.name: Bilma Casimira

texts.es: Bilma Casimira es originaria de la Ciudad de Somotillo, honesta, responsable, trabajadora, comerciante, cuenta con una tienda de ropa y calzado, es madre soltera  con tres hijos, a pesar de todos los inconvenientes que ha tenido  ha podido seguir adelante y brindarle lo mejor a su familia. su hijo menor esta Iniciando los módulos para optar al Titulo de Ing. Civil, por lo que se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para suplir estos gastos y que su hijo logre ser un profesional.
texts.en: Bilma Casimira was born in the city of Somotillo. She is an honest, responsible, and hardworking merchant. She has a clothing and shoe store and is the single mother of three children. Despite obstacles, she has been able to get ahead and give her family the best. Her youngest son is beginning courses to receive his degree in civil engineering, and she has applied to Ceprodel for a loan to pay these educational expenses so that her son can have a profession.

loans.use: to pay for courses and degree fee.

loans.name: Silvio José

texts.es:
El Señor  Silvio José reside en la cuidad de las Flores, Masaya, casado, con 53 años de edad, su núcleo familiar lo componen el y su esposa, de oficio panadero.

Su negocio consiste en la elaboración de pan francés y pan dulce, tiene experiencia de 21 años, el aprendió el oficio por su papa, empezó como ayudante en la  panadería y al fallecer su papa se la dejo en herencia, el elabora el pan todos los días, lo vende en su casa y a otros clientes que le entrega por encargo, vende todo de contado y sus insumos  se los compra a empresas distribuidora de harina, mantequilla etc.

En estos momentos de su vida en la que ya formo a sus  hijos, trabaja en su panadería para el sustento de el y su esposa,  es una actividad que le gusta mucho realizar y que sabe que contribuye con la alimentación de sus clientes ya que el pan para los Masaya es unos de los complementos esenciales en el desayuno

Actualmente esta requiriendo de un financiamiento   para poder comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, mantequilla, levadura y leña,

Ya que la demanda esta fuerte y también le entrega diariamente el pan al hospital de Masaya. Considera que este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y darle una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Silvio José lives in the city of Flores, Masaya. He is married and 53 years old. His nuclear family is made up of him and his wife. He is a baker.
His business consists of making French bread and sweet bread. He has 21 years of experience. He learned the trade from his father; he started as a helper in the bakery and when his father died, he bequeathed it to him. He makes bread every day. He sells it in his home and to other customers that make custom orders. He makes all his sales in cash and buys his inputs from companies that distribute flour, butter etc.
At this point in his life, when he has already raised his children, he works in the bakery to support himself and his wife. This is a business that he really likes, and he knows how to contribute to the feeding of his customers, since for the people of Masaya bread is one of the essential components of breakfast. He currently needs financing to be able to purchase flour, sugar, lard, butter, yeast and firewood, since demand is strong and he also brings bread daily to Masaya hospital. He thinks that this loan will help him to increase his income and make them more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, lard, butter, yeast and firewood.

loans.name: Freddy Hernan

texts.es:
Freddy tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la conyugue y con el hijo en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Freddy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y naranjilla, además cría pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insumos, abonos, fertilizante, balanceado, polvillo.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada semana.

El sueño es llegar a vender mayor cantidad de productos. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear por los alrededores vigilando los cultivos.
"Está muy agradecido por el anterior crédito".
texts.en:
Freddy, 32, lives in a free union and has a son. He lives with his partner and son in Guaranda province in Bolívar. He belongs to the communal bank Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons), located about 40 minutes away in Santa Martha in Guaranda province. Freddy grows blackberries and oranges and raises chickens and pigs. 

He is applying for a loan to buy urea, supplies, manure, fertilizer, feed, and ash. The loan will let him buy fertilizer. He buys and sells in Guaranda each week. He dreams of selling more products. In his free time, he likes to walk through his fields, checking on his crops. "I am very grateful for my prior loan."

loans.use: to buy urea, supplies, manure, fertilizer, feed, and ash.

loans.name: Muhridin

texts.ru: Мухридин житель Гиссарского района, расположенного на центрально-западной части Таджикистана.  Мухридину 56 лет. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Один его сын находится за пределами страны на заработках. У Мухридин высшее аграрное образование и он работал по своей специализации 22 года. Последние 6 лет он занимается земледелием и выращивает овощи, в основном картошку. Одновременно Мухридин работает шофером грузовой машины и перевозит грузы. Мухридин обратился за кредитом для своей земледельческой деятельности. Он берет кредит для приобретения семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. В будущем Мухридин планирует расширить свою деятельность и создать свое дехканское хозяйство. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане.
texts.en: Muhridin lives in the Gissar region, which is located in the west-central area of Tajikistan. He is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children. One of his sons is currently employed as a migrant worker abroad. Muhridin has a post-secondary education in agriculture, and he worked in that field for 22 years. For the last 6 years, he has been growing vegetable crops, mainly potatoes. At the same time, he works as a truck driver and hauls loads. He is seeking a loan for his crop-growing business. He wants to buy seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and establish his own dehkan farm. A dehkan farm is a small private farm owned by an individual or group that is worked by several people, on which the main crops grown are cotton, wheat or vegetables that account for 60% of irrigated land use in Tajikistan.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 58-year-old, vigorous lady. She has been in the work of stitching for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support. Her pants and coat stitching is very popular in her area.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: La Sra. Mery tiene 46 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un de las calles concurridas de la zona de Litoral,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Mery va a usar este préstamo para compra de material de construcción para la construcción de una habitación en su casa,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos materiales,  La Sra. Mery enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar su sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de su negocio para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo y cena, La Sra. Mery es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Mery is 46 years old. She makes her living selling food in one of the busy streets of the Litoral neighborhood. 

This loan is Mery's first within the institution. She is going to use the loan to purchase construction materials to build a room in her house. Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of cash for the purchase of materials. 

Mery faces challenges in her business, including weather conditions and also competition from other food-sales businesses, which is causing her to have to try to reduce her costs and improve the flavor of her dishes. She is going to use her profits to buy utensils and also to expand her business so that she can attract more customers during the peak lunch and dinner hours. 

Mery is a very hardworking person; she feels glad to have the opportunity provided by the granting of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Ms. Kouser is a 30-year-old, vigorous married woman. She has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges and daily expenses frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is conductor, and does not earn enough to support his family well. Kouser is a mother of five children and is responsible to provide them with a good environment with good food, clothing and education. 

Kouser’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls in various colors and in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms. Nasreen is a 54-year-old widow; she has been providing catering services with the support of her son for six years. 

Nasreen enjoys making food at home and has become famous in her town for providing these services. She takes orders from nearby hotels and people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

Nasreen is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. That is why she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy packs of oil, spices and salt in large quantity at lower rates from the market. This would enable her to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. Nasreen wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, spices and salt in large quantity at lower rates from the market.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлубе 40 лет, она замужем имеет 3 детей.  Муж  Матлубы работал электриком, сама Матлуба тоже работала, но  сложилась так, что они оба остались без работы.  Муж решил  заняться откормом скота, так как это приносит хоть и небольшой доход.  Тогда дети были малы и денег хватало, теперь когда дети выросли расходов стало очень много и  они стараются работать не покладая рук. Скотоводство единственный доход в семье.
 Также они мечтают построить свой дом, так как они живут с родителями и им очень тесно. Матлуба  не хочет продавать скот, потому что, от дохода скота  они могут понемногу начать строительство дома. Для этого она планирует еще закупить  скот , чтобы  муж мог продать по дороже через некоторое время. Матлуба с мужем очень надеются на помощь от Арванд, в получении кредита и покупки скота.
texts.en:
Matluba is 40 years old, she is married and has 3 children.  Matluba's husband worked as an electrician, Matluba also worked but circumstances were such that they both lost their jobs.  Her husband decided to raise livestock as this brings in at least a small income.  Back then the children were small and there was enough money, now when the children grew up expenditures also increased and they try to work as hard as they can.  Raising livestock is the only source of income for the family.

They also dream of building their own house, because they live with their parents and it is very crowded.  Matluba does not want to sell the livestock because they can use the profits from the livestock to slowly start building their house.  She plans to buy more livestock for this purpose, so that her husband can resell it for a higher price after some time.  Matluba and her husband are hoping for loan help from Arvand to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora María Mercedes  es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad,  posee un puesto de venta ubicado en unos de los mercados de  León desde hace 15 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora María Mercedes se acercó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito el cual desea aprovechar la temporada de verano para invertir en la compra de productos enlatados como sardinas, atún y pescado secos, productos que son tradicionales de la temporada y su clientela se los están solicitando.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is a single mother with two minor children. She has had a stand located in one of the Leon markets for 15 years, as this business is how she supports her family.

It is worth mentioning that María Mercedes approached Ceprodel to request a loan, as she wishes to take advantage of the summer season to invest in the purchase of canned products such as sardines, tuna and dried fish. These products are traditional for the season and her clients are requesting them.

loans.use: To buy sardines, tuna and dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase musical instruments for the students of her music school

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena es una joven de 25 años, humilde de escasos recursos que fue criada solo con esfuerzo de su madre, la que le inculcó buenos principios morales y religiosos.

Labora como auxiliar de contabilidad para una empresa en el municipio de El Sauce desde hace cuatro años y da gracias a Dios por tener un empleo digno el que le permite costear sus estudios y llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, ya que es ella ahora quien mantiene a su madre la cual ya no puede trabajar.

Su sueño es tener su título como contadora pública, actualmente está estudiando el último año de la carrera, por tal motivo solicita a Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien un crédito para pagar el trámite de dicho título con el cual tendrá un mejor nivel social y por ende mejores ingresos.

Confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para poder cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
María Elena is a humble 25-year-old young woman with few resources. She was raised by a single mother who instilled in her good moral and religious principles. 

For four years, María Elena has worked as an accounting assistant for a company in the city of El Sauce. She thanks God for having a decent job that allows her to pay for her education and provide for her household every day, since now it is she who supports her mother, who can no longer work.

María Elena's dream is to have her Public Accounting degree. She is currently in the final year of the degree program, so she is requesting a Kiva loan through Ceprodel to pay the processing fees associated with her diploma. With her degree, she will have a better position in society and therefore a better income. She trusts in God that her request will be approved so that she can realize her dream.

loans.use: to pay diploma fees required to receive her university degree.

loans.name: Gladys Ernestina

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys Ernestina es madre soltera  de cuatro hijos,  posee un pequeño negocio de venta de comida variada  en el departamento de León desde hace 15 años, inicia sus labores a las 8 am y finaliza a la 7 pm de lunes a domingo con este mismo horario, siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

La Señora Gladys Ernestina se presentó a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para realizar compras de productos al por mayor el cual ocupa para la elaboración de los distintos tipos de patillos y brindarle una gran variedad a su clientela.

Este trabajo lo realiza para aumentar sus ingresos de esa manera mejorando la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys Ernestina is a single mother of four children. For the past fifteen years she has had a small business selling food, located in the department of León. She starts working at 8am and finishes at 7pm, working Monday through Sunday. From this business she is able to support her family. 

Gladys Ernestina came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan which she will use to buy products at wholesale price, to make various types of dishes and to provide her customers with a wide variety of food. 

She works in her business to be able to increase her income, and by doing so increase the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: Compra de arroz, frijoles, leña, carne de res y pollo

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
JOSE tiene  27 años de edad es casado tiene hijos, vive  con la esposa en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

JOSE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de caña de azúcar, mora, naranjilla, además se dedica  a la críanza  animales como pollos y cerdos.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar la producción. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada semana.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia las malas vías y el mal clima. El sueño es poder comprar una camioneta para poder transportar los productos y para venderlos.  En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear por el campo y disfrutar de los deportes en especial el boly.

" Esta muy agradecido por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
José’s 27-year-old married and has children; he lives with his wife in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  He’s a member of the “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons) communal bank.  The community is located about 40 minutes away in Santa Martha belonging to Guaranda Canton.  

José works growing sugarcane, blackberries, ‘naranjilla’ [a tropical fruit] and also raises animals like chickens and pigs.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and insecticide.  With the loan’s help he’ll be able to increase production.  He makes his purchases and sales weekly in Guaranda.

The challenges he faces are competition, poor roads and bad weather.  His dream is to be able to buy a pick-up truck to transport his products to sale.  In his free time he enjoys wandering in the countryside and enjoying sports, especially playing volleyball.  He is very grateful for his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Shayasta

texts.en:
Shayasta had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work to support her family. So eight years ago she began sewing shoes in her house to earn money to contribute to the family’s income.

Shayasta receives orders from the shoe factory. But because she will have a shortage of materials to fill her orders on time, she is applying for a 40,000 PKR loan from Kashf Foundation to buy spools of thread and leather in larger quantities. She hopes to increase her earnings and wants to spend part of her new profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread and leather in larger quantities.

loans.name: Rony Salvador

texts.es:
EL señor Rony vive en la cuidad de managua trabaja en el area de vigilancia en un centro de compra de managua. casado con dos hijos se caracteriza por ser responsable con su familia.

El señor Rony esta solicitando a kiva un crédito para hacerles exámenes y pago medico  para su hija que esta mal de salud y  es necesario ya que su estado es delicado. agradeciendo mucho  ya con este financiamiento va a poder ayudar a su hija  para la recuperación.
texts.en:
Rony lives in Managua. He works in the department of surveillance in a shopping center in Managua. He is married with two children. He has a reputation as being responsible with his family. 

Rony is requesting a kiva loan to be able to do medical tests and pay a doctor for his daughter who is in poor health. This is now necessary because her situation is critical. He is very thankful because this loan will allow him to help his daughter recuperate.

loans.use: medical expenses and tests.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, T-shirts, blouses, talcum powders, crèmes, hair clips, remote controls, and other items.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara vive en la cuidad de Managua  soltera madre de dos  hijos pequeño en edad escolar trabaja   en  una empresa   como auxiliar contable de lunes sábado una mujer luchadora ,responsable muy esforzada con sus dos hijos  ya que ella ha salido adelante sola con sus hijos dándoles estudios y un hogar digno para ellos.

Xiomara solicita un crédito para gastos de estudios  para sus pequeños y  para la compra de  utensilio para el hogar ya que  lo considera necesario.

Agradeciendo mucho a kiva por los financiamiento obtenidos ya que ellos ha podido mejorar su casa  de habitación y darles un techo confortable a sus hijos
texts.en:
Xiomara lives in the city of Managua. She’s a single mother of two small, school age children.  She works for a firm as an accounting aide from Monday to Saturday.  She’s a hardworking, responsible woman who is very devoted to her two children since she’s gotten ahead alone with her two children providing schooling and a proper home for them.

Xiomara is asking for a loan to cover school costs for her little ones and to buy some items for the home she needs.  She is very thankful to Kiva for the financing obtained because thanks to it she’s been able to make home improvements and provide a comfortable home for her children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Juan Basilio

texts.es:
Don Juan Basilio es un señor de 61 años, originario del municipio de Achuapa, padre de 5 hijos, que se ha dedicado casi treinta años a impartir clases a niños de primaria.

A pesar de su edad ejerce su profesión con esmero y entusiasmo porque se siente bien de enseñar a leer y escribir ya que aporta un granito de arena a Niacragua.

Se siente muy agradecido con Kiva y Ceprodel por haberlo apoyado con los créditos que le ha otorgado porque ha mejorado su desarrollo económico y calidad de vida, ya que tiene mejores condiciones de vida, logró comprar una vaca la que se ha reproducido lo que mejora sus ingresos.

 Cabe señalar que sin la ayuda de estos financiamientos no se pudieran cumplir muchos sueños y metas porque los salarios en Nicaragua sobre todos de las personas más pobres son muy bajos.

Actualmente quiere mejorar la cocina de su vivienda, por tal razón está solicitando un crédito con el cual piensa comprar ladrillos, cemento, zinc y arena.

Espera que Kiva le siga apoyando y financie su solicitud.
texts.en:
Juan Basilio is a 61-year-old gentleman. He is a native of the city of Achuapa and the father of five children; for almost thirty years, he has earned his living teaching classes to primary school children.

Despite his age, he carries out his profession with care and enthusiasm; he feels good teaching reading and writing, since his work contributes a grain of sand to Nicaragua's development.

He feels very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for having supported him with the loans they have granted; he has improved his economic development and his quality of life, because he has better living conditions. He was able to buy a cow, which has reproduced, improving his income.

It is worth pointing out that without the help of this financing, many dreams and goals would have gone unfulfilled, because salaries in Nicaragua, especially those of the poorest people, are very low.

Currently, Juan Basilio wants to improve the kitchen of his home, so he is requesting a loan that he plans to use to buy bricks, cement, metal sheeting, and sand. 

He hopes that Kiva continues to support him and finances his request.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, metal sheeting, and sand.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 49-year-old married woman. Three years ago she bought a buffalo and began selling its milk when her husband became the family’s only breadwinner. With the passage of time her sales and income increased. Now she has three buffalo.

This has all happened due to Shamim’s courage and determination. Because of her work she is respected in her home. Both she and her husband share in all family and financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies.

Shamim is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She is applying for a 35,000 PKR loan, and along with some of her savings she will buy another buffalo. She expects a boost in her income as her dairy grows.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Ms. Lubna is a 37-year-old married woman; she uses a veil due to her religious restrictions. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching, with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Lubna’s husband.  

Lubna accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Lubna requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Lubna hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Antonia tiene 50 años casada con dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de dulces y golosinas y refrescos en su puesto de venta que se  encuentra ubicado en la zona de Santa Rosa,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Antonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de dulces para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra. Antonia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y  brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Antonia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Antonia, 50, is married and has two children attending school.  She sells a variety of candy, snacks and soft-drinks in her sales stand located in the Santa Rosa area.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Antonia will use the loan to buy a variety of candy to stock her business thus providing a variety of products to her customers.  The reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Antonia will use profits to continue buying products to continue improving her income.  Her wish for her business is to have a store and provide better customer service.  Antonia is a very hardworking woman who feels happy for the opportunity provided because this is the only activity she has that makes it possible for her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of candies to stock her business.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Manuel vive en la cuidad de managua trabaja en un institucion de gobierno como guarda de seguridad desde hace 13 años muy conocido en su trabajo por ser una persona respetuosa con sus compañeros.

don Carlos esta solicitando a kiva y ceprodel  un crédito para terminar de construir su casa ya que le falta la construcción de una pared  en la parte de adelante de su vivienda para darle mayor seguridad a su familia 
agradeciendo mucho por el financiamiento por que gracias a eso va poder concluir su vivienda
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel lives in the city of Managua. He has worked for a government institution as a security guard for the last 13 years.  He’s very well-known at work for being a person who is respectful to his coworkers.  

Carlos is asking Kiva and Ceprodel for a loan to finish building his house since he still needs to erect a wall in the front of the house to provide better security for his family.  He is very grateful for the financing because thanks to it he’ll be able to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
For 20 years, Saleem has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased, as did her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Now, her two sons also support her family.

Because of her work, Saleem is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as in financial matters. While talking to the Kashf Foundation officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. This is Saleem's fourth loan cycle and she has shown excellent repayment behavior. 

Saleem expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf Foundation for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Tomas De Jesús

texts.es:
Masaya cuidad de las flores y cuna del folklore Nicaragüense lugar donde nació Don  Tomas, desde hace  50 años, casado, comerciante. Su núcleo familiar lo componen el y su esposa, sus hijos ya formados e independiente.

Don Tomas posee su negocio de una  pulpería, este lo administra a lado de su esposa, entre los dos han salido adelante ya que también aparte de este negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa, también sale a vender CD de video y música.

Comenta que a él no le gusta estar sin hacer nada para la edad que tiene se siente con muchas ganas de seguir superándose en lo que el le gusta, es una persona muy activa, con buenos valores morales, y muy trabajador.

 Sus clientes son sus vecinos, transeúntes, personas  que vienen de zonas rurales y ahí es donde tiene mas concentrado su clientela.

 El realiza su compras enabas para los granos básicos y el resto de sus productos los compra en el mercado municipal.

En estos momentos esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertir en su pulpería, gaseosas, aceite, frijol, azúcar, leña golosinas, arroz. Manifiesta que este financiamiento le permitirá atender mejor a su cliente al contar con variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Tomas was born in Masaya, the city of flowers and birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore.  He’s 50-years-old, married and a merchant.  His nuclear family is composed of his wife and children who are all now independent adults.

Tomas has a grocery store he runs with his wife.  Between the two of them they have gotten ahead because in addition to this home-based business he also goes out to sell video and music CDs.  He comments that he does not like to be idle and despite his age is still very motivated to continue improving and making progress doing what he likes to do.  He’s a very active, hardworking man with good moral values.  His customers are neighbors, passersby and people who come from the rural zones; this is where his greatest clientele is concentrated.  He buys his basic grains from the wholesale foodstuffs market and the other products at the municipal market.

At present, he’s requesting a loan to invest in his grocery store.  He will buy soft-drinks, oil, beans, sugar, firewood, snacks and rice.  He states that this loan will make it possible for him to provide better customers service by having a wider variety of goods available.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and to pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Jaime Arcidas

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 28 años de edad de esdao civil soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Jaime se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de naranjilla y mora, además se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cerdos pollos y ganado.

Solicita el crédito para compra de semillas, insumos, abonos, fertlizantes, urea. Con el dinero podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada semana.

 Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y  la competencia. El sueño es vender mayor cantidad de productos a un buen precio. En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades.

" Esta muy agradecido por el crédito anterior".
texts.en:
Jaime, 28, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  He’s a member of the “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons) communal bank located about 40 minutes away in the community of Santa Martha belonging to Guaranda Canton.

Jaime works in agriculture growing ‘naranjilla’ [a tropical fruit] and blackberries; he also works raising animals like pigs, chickens and cattle to sell.  He’s asking for this loan to buy seeds, supplies, manure, fertilizer and urea.  With the money he’ll be able to buy what he needs for agriculture.  He makes his sales and purchases weekly in Guaranda.  The challenges he faces are competition and plant infestations.  His dream is to sell more products at a good price.  He likes enjoying festivities in his free time.  He’s very grateful for the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Gilberth Julian

texts.es:
Gilberth tiene 24 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos, vive con la esposa y los hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Gilberth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, naranjilla, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, pollos y ganado.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, hervicidas, vacunas y vitaminas para los animales.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda semanalmente. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar  lo necesario para mejorar la producción.

El sueño es llegar a obtener mayor cantidad de productos y que la familia tenga salud. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las malas vías de acceso y mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.

"Está muy agradecido por el crédito anterior que le ha servido de mucho".
texts.en:
Gilberth, 24, is married and has two children; he lives with his wife and children in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  He’s a member of the “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons) communal bank located about 40 minutes away in the community of Santa Martha belonging to Guaranda Canton.  

Gilberth works in agriculture growing blackberries and ‘naranjilla’ [a tropical fruit] and also works raising pigs, chickens and cattle.  He’s asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizer, urea, herbicide and vaccines and vitamins for the animals.  He makes his purchases and sales weekly in Guaranda.  With the loan’s help he’ll be able to buy what he needs to improve production.

His dream is to succeed in producing higher amounts of products and that his family has good health.  The challenges he faces are poor roads and bad weather.  He likes going out on family excursions in his free time.  He’s very grateful for the previous loan that was very useful.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Ms. Nargis is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. For the past ten years, Nargis has been running a business of milk sales. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Because of her work, Nargis is respected in her home. She helps with her family matters, as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. 

Nargis expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: La Ñusta Iii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Ceferina (es la socia que levanta la mano) ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas, naranjas, platanos, cebollas, zapallos entre otros, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas, platanos, cebollas y zapallos.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganadería, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the La Ñusta III communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.  Ceferina (raising her hand) is married, 53-years-old and has three children.  She works in her business selling fruit and vegetables.  She sells apples, oranges, bananas, onions and pumpkins, among others.  She’s been in business seven years and does very well.  Her dream is to expand the fruit and vegetable business.  She’s asking for the loan to buy apples, oranges, bananas, onions and pumpkins.  She is grateful to those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.                                                                                                                                                                    
The other members work raising cattle, selling food, are grocers and sell animals.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Jeremias Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Juana tiene 37 años de edad, acompañada,  tiene cuatros hijos desde hace 4 años  se dedica a vender cosméticos de la Avon, Vogue, y venta de ropa nueva, tiene tres años de que la institución le brinda créditos que a pagado con responsabilidad, su hija mayor le ayuda en el negocio  a vender y recuperar  los créditos de los productos a la clientela, anteriormente trabajaba como cocinera de un kiosco de una institución estatal, con el préstamo anterior logro incrementar sus inventario de cosméticos, el crédito lo solicita para compra de cosméticos de la Avon como cremas faciales, crema para manos, cremas para cuerpo, lociones, perfumen de varón, perfumen de mujer, pinturas de uñas, pinturas labios, delineadores etc. Johana tiene 36 años de edad tiene una pulpería y vende ropa usada y ropa nueva y Dina vende manzanas, artículos eléctricos y ferreteros  como extensión, candados etc.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three enterprising members.  One of them is Juana, 37.  She has a spouse and four children.  She’s been selling Avon and Vogue cosmetics and new clothes for four years.  She’s been getting loans from the institution for three years that she’s repaid responsibly.  Her oldest daughter helps her with the business selling and collecting payments from customers.  She used to work as a cook in a kiosk in a state institution.  With her previous loan she was able to increase her inventory of cosmetics.  The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy Avon cosmetics like face cream, hand cream, body cream, lotion, men’s perfume, women’s perfume, nail polish, lipstick, eyeliner, etc.

Johana, 36, has a grocery store and also sells used and new clothes and Dina sells apples, electronic devices and hardware like extension cords, padlocks, etc.

loans.use: to buy Avon products.

loans.name: Ghulam-Zanab

texts.en:
Ms. Ghulam-Zanab is a 29-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk sales.  She has two buffaloes and two cows in milk; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis.  

Ghulam-Zanab is a mother of four children; one is school-going. She needs to earn much more to meet the everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to increase the milk production capacity, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy one more cow in order to cater to more customers. 

She hopes to get an increase in her net income and dreams to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 35-year-old, married woman and has been doing a business of milk sales for the past eight years. She has two buffaloes in milk; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life.

Lubna is a mother of three and is motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life, with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

Lubna has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf Foundation for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Haidee ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de carbón y leña, la socia vende al por mayor a los diferentes lugares que venden leña y carbon, la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender carbón y leña. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leña y carbón al por mayor. 
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganadería, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Tres Marías” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  Haidee, 42, is married and has two children.  She works in her business selling charcoal and firewood.  She sells at wholesale to various places that sell charcoal and firewood.  She’s been in this business for six years now and does very well.  She’s able to support her children by means of this business.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell charcoal and firewood.  She’s requesting the loan to buy charcoal and firewood at wholesale.  She thanks those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.  The other members sell cattle, food, groceries and animals.      

The members in the inserted photo took their photo after the meeting having asked permission due to work.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes for her retail shop and make bricks to build a house.

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Evelina, who is in her early 20s, is married with two children. One goes to school and the other one is still young. She has been a food-vendor for two years now. She works from 6.00am to 8.pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Evelina's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in her food store. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to help her husband to buy food and pay household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of food so as to sell to more people. She dreams of owning a big hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Wega" which has a total of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food and sell to more people.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ms. Ghazala is a 21-year-old vigorous lady. She has been sewing clothes for the past three years. She sews clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

The income of her brothers is not enough to bear all the household expenses, so Ghazala is working hard to contribute to the family income. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, Ghazala requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

Ghazala intends to use this loan amount to buy an electronic sewing machine with packs of thread, buttons and zippers in various colors. This will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine with packs of thread, buttons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Shushan

texts.en:
Shushan is from Aygestan village. She has been involved in agriculture for 15 years. Shushan keeps five mother pigs, 26 little pigs, 60 chickens and five turkeys. She also owns a little orchard where she grows peach trees with great love and care. Shushan lives with her husband and son who is five years old. 

Together with her husband Shushan works hard to run the farm and cover daily costs. Realizing that the farming business is the only source of income for the family, Shushan would like to expand her business. As she has not got sufficient funds to cover farm's costs she has applied for this loan.

With the loan's help she will purchase forage to feed her pigs. This will allow her to feed them and continue the expansion of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Apocalipsis Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado  por tres socias una de ella es Damaris mujer de 25 años, acompañada, con tres hijos menores de edad 2, 7, y 5 años respectivamente tiene cinco años de vender ropa usada, ropa nueva fue guardando su ganancias lo que hace poco puso una pulpería en su domicilio, el crédito lo invertirá en el reforzamiento de productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, leche, huevos, medicamentos populares, etc. Rosamelia tiene 41 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y prendas romanel y María Elena repara y vende celulares  en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group consists of three members. One of them is a 25-year-old woman named Damaris. She is married and has three young children (ages 2, 7, and 5 respectively). For the past five years she has been selling new and used clothing. She used the profits to open a store in her home. Her loan will be invested in products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, dairy products, milk, eggs, popular medicines, and other items.

Rosamelia, age 41, has a business of selling used clothing and Romanel jewelry. María Elena repairs and sells mobile phones from her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, dairy products, milk, eggs, popular medicines, and other items.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She has been selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of them from the city and then sells them to the people in her community. She now is known for her good-quality clothes and fabrics.

Tahira has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of summer season clothes to accommodate the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way she will be able to earn more income through increased sales.

Tahira hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of paying for a good quality education for her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a stock of summer season clothes.

loans.name: Feya

texts.en:
Feya is from Avshar village of Ararat region. She has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years and that is the main source of the family's income. She keeps 20 chickens, cultivates wheat and grows apricot trees.

Concerned with the critical state of the economy, Feya does her best to perpetuate the profit which will help her to ensure a well-provided life for her family. She is married with two children.

To expand her agricultural business Feya has applied for this loan. Her dream is to increase the family’s profit and be able to ensure a better life for her children.

With the help of the loan Feya will purchase fertilizer and will cover cultivation costs. It is very important for Feya to gather a bigger harvest and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and cover cultivation costs.

loans.name: Baghdasar

texts.en:
Baghdasar is from Aygavan village, of the Ararat region. He has been involved in agriculture for 15 years and it is the main source of his family's income. 

Baghdasar keeps two pigs, cultivates wheat, and grows peach, apricot, cherry, plum, and apple trees. Baghdasar works hard to gather a good harvest and sustain his family of five: wife, parents, daughter (six years old) and son (eight years old). Baghdasar sells the gathered harvest in the local market and earns income which helps him to cover his family's daily costs. 

He has applied for this loan to purchase a calf, two pigs, forage for feeding the livestock, and fertilizer. It is very important for Baghdasar to expand his farm and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, two pigs, forage for feeding the livestock, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Raffi

texts.en:
Raffi is a proactive young man from Areni village. He works as driver-distributor in a local company and also is engaged in agriculture.

Raffi keeps two cows and eight chickens and also grows peaches, apricots, nuts, apples and pear trees. He works hard to gather good harvest and sell it in the local market. As agriculture helps Raffi to have stable income throughout the month, and his salary is hardly enough to cover basic costs, Raffi has applied for this loan.

With the help of the loan he will purchase two cows and two calves. This will expand his agricultural activity and will help him to earn higher income.
Raffi lives with his parents and does his best to ensure better life for them.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and two calves.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Aside from being a housekeeper, Alpha is also managing their rice farming business with the support of her husband. Alpha grows rice in their field. Her goal is to harvest a better yield and get a higher income. With regards to her goal, Alpha wants to sustain her rice-growing with enough fertilizer and to apply herbicides to avoid pests and diseases. 

Alpha is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides for the rice in their field. She believes that by acquiring the loan, it will help her attain her goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for the rice in their field.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is the mother of three children who all go to school. Ten years ago her family was having a difficult time after her husband's business failed, so she decided to go to work. She began sewing from her house for people in her neighborhood and uses the income to support her entire family.

However, due to a lack of money she has found herself unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is applying for a 20,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and zippers in different colors. This will help her to complete her customers’ orders without fail. She is working hard to provide a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, packs of buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Riolita

texts.en:
Planting and harvesting of rice is the main source of income in the Philippines. Riolita is one of the farmers whose primary source of income comes from growing rice. Riolita sends her children to school thanks to her income from her farming business. 

Nowadays, farm inputs in the market are costly due to the increase in demand from farmers. Riolita admits that she is finding it difficult to finance her farm needs due to her financial shortages. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides. 

Through the loan, she will get all the farm inputs she needs to grow rice in their fields.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is loving woman who is engaged in a rice-farming business. Imelda is married and has children who are attending school. Imelda’s husband is a farmer who is her partner in managing their farm. Imelda's goal in life is to send all her children to college. That’s why she is striving to achieve her goal.

Imelda has a hard time financing her rice farm because when she has additional money, she always prioritizes her children's school needs. In this context, Imelda is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for her rice. She hopes to get a high yield and earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for her rice.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 30 años de edad estado civil casada tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo y con el esposo en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Vrc Nuevos Horizontes, la comunidad se encuentra a unos 40 minutos en la comunidad santa Martha perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda.

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, naranjilla, además se dedica a la críanza pollos para poder venderlos.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, balanceado, urea, abono orgánico. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda cada 15 días. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos y la comida para los pollos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima y las plagas. El sueño es aumentar la cantidad de productos para venderlos. En el tiempo libre le gusta organizar los paseos con la familia.
texts.en:
Zoila is 30 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with her husband and son in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Zoila is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons), which is about 40 minutes away from the community of Santa Martha in the canton of Guaranda.

Zoila is a farmer who grows blackberries and “naranjillas”. She also raises chickens to sell. Zoila is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, balanced feed, urea, and organic matter. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Guaranda every 15 days. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy supplies and feed for her chickens. The challenges she faces include dealing with bad weather and pests.

Zoila dreams of increasing the quantity of products that she can sell. In her free time, she likes to organize walks with her family.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, balanced feed, urea, and organic matter.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a hardworking father who has no greater wish than to give his family better way of living and live happily. Antonio is a farmer who is engaged in growing rice in their field. Antonio is very careful with his planted rice. He always sees to it that his rice is in good condition.

His only worries are what will happen to his rice when it is hit by drought, typhoon, pest and diseases. Antonio wishes for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy fertilizers, herbicides and fuel to irrigate his planted rice. He hopes, through this loan, to be able to respond immediately to the needs of his farm, to gain income and achieve his wishes for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and fuel to irrigate his planted rice.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is engaged in a retail business. With her determination to succeed and to help her husband to provide for their needs, Jocelyn is also running a rice-farming business. She helps her husband running the business, exchanging ideas for better results.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for her rice. She hopes to use the loan properly and manage well the business to get high yields and profits as well. Through her earnings from farming, she will immediately be able to provide for their needs and hopes to succeed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for her rice.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and lucky to be married to a kind man who grows rice in their field. Josephine and her husband's priority in life is to send their children to school until college. They want their children to find better jobs and if their children finish their education they will have a better future.

Josephine and her husband are striving to give their children basic necessities and provide for their needs in school. Sometimes she has a difficult time to provide for her children as she also has to pay for the farm's needs. Thus, Josephine is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for her rice. Josephine is hoping for a better yield and to increase her income for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for her rice.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Her husband is employed in a small factory but earns insufficient income to support his family by himself. Motivated to provide for her family, seven months ago Nasreen started running a small general store in her community.

Nasreen’s store has been a success. She offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. She has good communication skills and has cultivated a good clientele.

As she wants to grow her business, Nasreen is applying for a 30,000 PKR loan to buy stocks of rice and flour along with packs of beverages. She then would be able to meet her customers’ increasing demands consistently. She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes use her profits to deal with personal expenses and increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour along with packs of beverages.

loans.name: Alda Lucia

texts.es: Doña Alda madre de familia, continua con su labor como costurera medio por el que ha salido adelante pagando sus créditos obtenidos por Afodenic y Kiva, los que ha invertido en mejoras de su hogar, ahora desea construir un cuarto para la comodidad de su hija, necesitara comprar materiales como cemento,hierro, arena, bloques y piedrín, así irá mejorando su vivienda para estar en mejores condiciones con la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Alda is a mother who continues to work as a seamstress so that she can keep paying the loans she received from AFODENIC and Kiva. The money was invested in home improvements.

Now she wants to build a room so that her daughter will be more comfortable. Alda needs to buy materials such as cement, iron, sand, blocks, and gravel. Making these improvements to her home will provide better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, blocks, and gravel.

loans.name: Mark Angelo

texts.en:
Mark Angelo is twenty years old, single, yet is a business-minded person. He farms corn and raises hogs.

Mark Angelo is applying for a 40,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy supplies for his hogs and farm. He believes that such supplies will keep his hogs healthier and growing well. He just hope that lenders will fulfill his loan so he can get ahead in life and improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his hogs and farm.

loans.name: Loveness Kivule Group

texts.en:
Antipasi, who is in his early 20s, is single. He has been running a Genge-duka (which means selling fruits, vegetables, rice, beans, backing flour, wheat flour, beans, sweets, sugar etc. in the same shop) for one year now.  He works from 7.00 am to 7.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Antipasi's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. He used the previous loan to increase the Genge-duka business and he has successfully paid back his loan. He used the profit to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the missing items in his Genge-Duka. He dreams of building his own house.

Antipasi will share this loan with his loan group, 'Loveness Kivule,' which has 14 members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his Genge-Duka (where he sells fruits, vegetables, sugar, beans, rice, cooking oil, flour, etc.).

loans.name: Malengo Group

texts.en:
Jackson, who is in his late 30s, is married and has two children, one boy and one girl.  Both of them are still going to school.  He has been running different types of businesses, poultry and milk selling, for six years now.  He works from 5.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jackson's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start all his businesses.  He used to have a garden, where he planted and sold vegetables. Then he bought chicks, fed them until adulthood, and sold them at a good price. He bought a calf, fed it until it became a big cow, and now he sells milk in plenty. He has managed to repay all his loans successfully. He used the profits to build two houses and covered his household's living expenses. He will use this new loan to buy chicken feed and insecticide. His dream is to become an international businessman.

Jackson will share this loan with his loan group, Malengo, which has 15 members in total, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and insecticide.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine and her family have been engaged in agriculture for more than ten years. Despite her young age (25 years old), she works hard to help her parents to sustain the family. She lives with her mother, brother, grandfather, and husband. The whole family, jointly with Lusine, runs a farm and works hard to cultivate more fruits and vegetables and to gather a good harvest. 

The family owns two greenhouses which are old and need to be renovated. Since Lusine does not have sufficient funds to renovate the greenhouses, she has applied for this loan.

With the loan's help, Lusine will renovate the greenhouses and will be able to cultivate fruits and vegetables more effectively. The loan is very important for Lusine and her family to gather a high income and have appropriate living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of two greenhouses.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen is farmer from Aygavan village, in Ararat region. He has been running a farm for 15 years, and it has become a part of his life. He keeps 10 little pigs and 30 chickens, and he grows peach, apricot, cherry, plum, apple and pear trees. He is very hard working and does his best to gather a good harvest and sustain his wife's and son's living.

Vazgen owns a greenhouse, which is too old and needs to be renovated. As his monthly income is hardly enough for covering daily costs, it is very difficult for him to pay for the renovation. Vazgen has applied for this loan to renovate the greenhouse, as well as to purchase tomato seeds, fertilizer, and forage for feeding pigs. Realizing that the farm business is the main source of his family's income, Vazgen would like to expand it and earn higher income.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, fertilizer, forage for feeding pigs, and to renovate the old greenhouse

loans.name: Señoras De Taguan  (Sigsig) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Señoras de Taguan está formado por 8 mujeres quienes se dedican a las tareas del campo como es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, las más jóvenes trabajan en la ciudad pero su objetivo en común es sacar adelante a sus familias y mejorar su estabilidad economía, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en el cantón Sigsig lugar que se encuentra rodeado de exuberante vegetación, por su geografía accidentada y sus hermosos paisajes es un placer viajar a este lugar..

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elvia, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amiga y compañeras del banco comunal Señoras del Taguan, vive por el sector de San Bartolo perteneciente al cantón Sigsig.

Doña Elvia tiene 41 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 21, 19, 15, 13 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija ya es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y es quien le ayuda económicamente, sus dos hijos siguientes estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuelita de la localidad.
