She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 41, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, a construction worker, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rebecca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rebecca hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Alpha Bakarr

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Alpha Bakarr.  He is married, and has three children who are 5, 10 and 15 years old. In 2009, Alpha Bakarr established his house decoration business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are all ages and sexes. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 805,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Alpha Bakarr has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to buy more bedspreads, window linings, frames and flowers. He hopes that this loan will help by increasing his stock. In the future, Alpha Bakarr plans to move to a shop and be able to provide the needs of the family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bedspreads, window linings, picture frames and flowers

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru: Мирали 63 года. Он женат. У него 6 сыновей и 4 дочери. Он со своей большой семьей проживает в районе Бохтар в юго-западной части Таджикистана. В данное время его сыновья уехали на заработки в Россию. Один сын занимается предоставлением услуг на мотороллере. Мирали со своей женой работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Дехканское хозяйство это небольшое индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором работают несколько людей и где в основном выращивают хлопок, пшеницу или овощи - которые занимают 60% орошаемых земель в Таджикистане. Также Мирали является организатором свадеб в своем кишлаке. Сейчас Мирали планирует начать бизнес в сфере торговли, так как он имеет опыт работы в этой сфере. Он уже арендовал один магазин в центре района Бохтар и теперь ему необходимо приобрести товар. Он хочет заняться куплей и продажей материалов и женской одежды. С этим намерением он обратился за кредитом. Полученный кредит он использует для приобретения материалов и женской одежды.
texts.en: Mirali is 63 years old. He is married and has six sons and four daughters. He lives with his big family in the Bohtar region in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. At this time his sons went to work in Russia. One son provides services on a motor-roller. Mirali works in the "dehkan" collective farm with his wife. A dehkan collective farm is a small individual or private collective farm where a small number of people work and where cotton, wheat and vegetables are mainly grown which take up 60% of arable land in Tajikistan. Mirali is also an organizer of weddings in his village. Right now Mirali plans to start a business in the field of sales where he has a working experience. He already rented out one store in the center of Bohtar and now he needs to buy merchandise. He wants to start buying and reselling materials and women's clothing. He has come for a loan with this purpose. He plans to use the loan to buy materials and women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy and resell materials and women's clothing.

loans.name: Las Lindas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gema es una mujer tiene 25 años joven emprendedora tiene cinco años dedicarse a la comercialización de cosméticos de la Avon, venta de ropa nueva. Tiene dos años de estar en la institución y solicita crédito para invertir en cosméticos de la Avon como perfumen de varón, perfumen de damas, lociones, cremas facial Anew, delineadores, ropa interior intima de damas, lencerías etc. con el crédito  anterior logro que sus productos de cosméticos sufrieran un incremento de más productos y además pago compromisos personales, Vilma tiene 32 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de Zelsa, Avon y vende zapatos y Jennifer tiene 23 años de edad vende bisuterías y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three entrepreneurial women. One of them is Gema, who is 25 years old and a young entrepreneur that has been selling Avon cosmetics and clothes for five years. Gema has been working with the institution for two years and is requesting a loan to invest in Avon cosmetics, such as perfumes for men and for women, lotions, Anew face creams, eyeliners, women underwear, lingerie, etc. With the previous loan, she increased her stock and paid for some personal expenses.

The remaining members are Vilma, 32, who sells Avon and Zelsa cosmetics and shoes, and Jennifer, 23, who sells imitation jewelry and clothes.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, such as perfumes, lotions, facial creams, eyeliners, and women underwear.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Gladis ella es conviviente y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de desayunos, la socia vende quinua con leche, chocolate y mates,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 12:00 p.m,ella trabaja en este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar postres, el sueño de la socia es tener su restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como quinua, leche, panes y azúcar para que prepare sus desayunos. 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanias.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are all members of communal bank ”KANTU SAN JERÓNIMO”, located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Mrs. Gladis, 37, lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. She works as a street vendor, selling breakfasts (quinoa with milk, cocoa and mate) from 5:00 am to 12:00 pm. Gladis has been doing this for five years and does very well. During her free time, she likes to prepare desserts and her dream is to open a restaurant.

Gladis is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her breakfasts, such as quinoa, milk, bread and sugar. The remaining members sell beauty products, clothes, groceries and handicrafts.

Gladis wants to thank all those who make part of her dream through Kiva and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as quinoa, milk, bread and sugar.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras y frutas como por ejemplo naranjas, piñas, plátanos y otras frutas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas.
texts.en: Margot is 32 years old. She is married and from this beautiful relationship has three children. She was born in the city of Urubamba and lives in the same city where she was born. Her economic activity is selling fruit and vegetables, for example, oranges, pineapples, plantains and more. She has worked in this this business for several years and it is going well thanks to the dedication she outs into her work. She belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles” communal bank and at this time she needs the loan to buy fruit.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 58 años de edad y es viuda pero tiene seis hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urquillos de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de flores y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar flores.
texts.en: Dominga is 58 years old. She is a widow but she has six children. She was born in the city of Urquillos in the province of Urubamba and lives in the same city where she was born. Her main economic activity is selling flowers and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has had this business for several years and it is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. She belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles” communal bank and at this time she needs the loan to buy flowers.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Apu Curi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU CURI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Rosario ella es conviviente y tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz, azúcar, leche y azúcar, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para su tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Apu Curi.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de crianza de animales, negocio de venta de cuyes, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de agricultura.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “APU CURI” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cuzco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

The member's name is Rosario. She is 28, in a common law marriage and the mother of 1 child. She works at her business, which is a small grocery store. She sells rice, sugar, milk and oil. She sells basic necessity products, working from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 7 years. Her dream is to expand the store. She is asking for the loan to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.

The member whose face is covered no longer belongs to the Apu Curi communal bank. 

The other members' businesses are raising and selling animals, selling guinea pigs, a grocery store and farming.

Rosario is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk and oil.

loans.name: Saqr

texts.en:
Saqr, 23, is a single man who lives at his uncle`s home in Hodeida, Yemen. His mother is divorced and his father has immigrated outside of Yemen. He is a hardworking man who likes to depend on himself. He feels pity for his mother so he works hard to provide for her daily expenses. He was a worker in a retail shop. He didn`t complete his studying due to the bad situation he faced. Over time, he has collected a small amount and intends to buy a bus, but he knows that it costs more money and he doesn't yet have enough money to purchase a bus.

He applied for a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy a bus to increase his daily income.
 
He hopes to improve his living standards and own an extra bus.

loans.use: to buy a bus to increase his daily income.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 43 años de edad y es madre y padre para sus tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urquillos de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras, fruta y maíz también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.
texts.en: Teodora, 43, is both a mother and a father to her three children. She was born in the city of Urquillos, Urubamba province, and still lives there. Teodora’s main line of work is vegetable and fruit sales, although she also raises farm animals, such as guinea pigs and hens. She has been doing this for some years now and she does well, thanks to her persistence. Teodora is a member of the communal bank “Reyna de los Ángeles” and is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es: Primitiva tiene 70 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene  ocho hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras, fruta y maíz también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 70 years old and married.  She has eight children from this beautiful relationship.

Primitiva was born in the city of Urubamba, in Urubamba province, and still lives there.  Her main business is selling fruit, vegetables and corn.  She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  She is a member of the 'Reyna de los Angeles' community bank and, on this occasion, she needs a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es: Jose María, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tienen cuatro hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece a Siguatepeque.  El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura principalmente de café, lleva aproximadamente 20 años de dedicarse a este rubro. La producción que saca es en pergamino y lo vende a intermediarios de la zona. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado de 12,000 lempiras va comprar abonos y va cubrir gastos de limpieza y siembra de café. Este préstamo le ayudara a darle mejor asistencia a sus cultivos y a sacar mejor producción. Su plan es lograr un mejor nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Jose María is 37 years old and lives with his partner.  The couple have four children and live in a small village in Siguatepeque.  José María has always been a coffee farmer.  He has been in this line of work for approximately 20 years.  He sells his dried, unhulled coffee beans to middlemen in his area.  He will use the 12,000 lempira loan he has requested to buy fertilizers, and cover the costs associated with weeding and sowing his coffee.  This loan will help him to better tend to his crops and enjoy a higher yield.  His plan is to achieve a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, and to cover costs associated with weeding and sowing his coffee crops

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es: Rosalio tiene 48 años de edad y es soltero pero tiene un hijo, él nació en la ciudad de Yucay de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la  distribución de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, detergentes, limpiadores, jaboncillos, jabones, gaseosas, refrescos, aceites y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar.
texts.en: Rosalio is 48 years old and single.  He has one son.  Rosalio was born in the city of Yucay, in Urubamba province, and still lives there.  His main business is distributing basic household products such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, detergents, cleaners, soap, soda, soft drinks, oils, etc.  He has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  He is a member of the 'Reyna de los Angeles' community bank and, on this occasion, he needs a loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda, tiene 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Comayagua. Hace 6 años que ella pudo establecer una pulpería donde vende huevos, carnes, dulces, abarrotes, embutidos, manteca, arroz, churros, lácteos, etc. Ademas presta el servicio de molienda de maiz para tortillas. Su negocio ha sido rentable ya cuenta con buena clientela. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar más productos para surtir la pulpería e incrementar las ventas. Ella tiene como meta mejorar su calidad de vida con las ganancias que genere el negocio.
texts.en: Esmeralda is 32 years old and married. She has 4 children and lives in a district of the municipality of Comayagua. Six years ago, she was able to establish a neighborhood store, where she sells eggs, meat, sweets, groceries, cold cuts, shortening, rice, churros, dairy products, etc. She also provides the service of milling corn for tortillas. Her business has been profitable, since she has a good customer base. She has decided to request a loan of  20,000 lempiras, with which she will buy more products to stock her store and increase her sales. Her goal is to improve her quality of life with the earnings generated by her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, corn flour, sugar, beans, pasta, dairy products and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Dilnia

texts.en:
Dilnia is a 29-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of three children. Dilnia has a part-time job as a cleaner at an educational establishment in her neighborhood. She also is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate extra income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. 

Dilnia has 3 years' experience with this little home based sewing activity. She enjoys making custom order dresses for women and children using her old, trusted sewing machine. While she has no problems with her old machine, she would like to improve her work area to make her work time a little more enjoyable and offer a nicer atmosphere for her customers. 

To pay for the renovation work Dilnia took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2,400 USD.

Dilnia is under 30, and as such qualifies for a 'youth loan'.

loans.use: to improve her work area and pay for the needed renovation work.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Don Leonel, tiene 47 años de edad, esta soltero y tiene dos hijos, el vive en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Anteriormente se ha dedicado a la agricultura y al comercio. Hace 4 años decidió por establecer su propio negocio en su casa donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, productos de limpieza, refrescos churros, pan, manteca, harinas, etc. También hace fletes con su vehículo lo que le genera otros ingresos. Esta solicitando un tercer prestamo a ODEF por 15,000 Lempiras con el cula va surtir de productos la pulperia. Su plan es trabajar para mejorar las ventas y su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Leonel is 47 years old, single, and has two children.  He lives in a small village in Choloma, Cortes.  In the past, he has worked in farming and commerce.  Four years ago, he decided to set up his own business at home selling household products such as basic grains, cleaning products, soft drinks, churros, bread, butter, flour, etc.  He also provides a cargo transport service with his vehicle which makes him additional income.

Leonel is requesting his third loan from ODEF, for 15,000 lempiras, so that he can stock his grocery store.  His plan is to work hard to improve his sales and his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food products for his grocery store

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Mr. Altangerel is 52 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Sanjaajav, aged 50, is retired and stays home. His older two children work in Ulaanbaatar city. Altangerel's son Narmandah, aged 23, works in a local company and his son Enhtaivan, aged 17, is a senior student at the local secondary school. 

The borrower has been working at a children's store for five years now. His wife worked as a saleswoman at a butcher shop before and has experience in the business. He is now requesting 2,600,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products for his wife to start her butcher shop business at a rental counter in the local market.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products.

loans.name: Muath

texts.en: Muath is a 25-year-old single guy. He has three siblings. Muath is in his last year at the university and when he faced a little financing trouble, he applied for an educational loan to help him pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is a 40-year-old married woman. She is very conservative, which is why her husband appears in the photo instead of her.

Kefa is the mother of four sons and daughters. Kefa and her husband work in shifts at their own food market, where they mostly sell food products. They now want to start also selling detergents in addition to food. For this reason, Kefa has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy detergents to sell.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 20-year-old single lady. She lives with her five siblings and her parents. She applied once before for an educational loan that helped her go through the previous year and is now applying for another loan to continue with her studies by paying her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 47-year-old conservative married woman, so she asked her daughter Christine to take her place in the photo.

Sanaa is a mother to four boys and girls, two of whom are business administration students. Having two in the university has increased the financial pressure on the family, so for that Sanaa has applied for an educational loan that will help the family in supporting their education.

loans.use: To pay her children's semester fees.

loans.name: Nedal

texts.en: Nedal is a 41-year-old woman who has a daughter studying in the university to get a Bachelor's degree. Nedal is applying for an educational loan to support her daughter in her studies.

loans.use: to support her daughter in her studies.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 41-year-old married lady who is the mother of two sons. Her husband has his own barber shop. Mona sells clothes from her home to provide another small source of income and make a better use of her time. She is now applying for a loan to buy new spring clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy new spring clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nadera

texts.en:
Nadera is a 29-year-old mother of two girls and one boy. Nadera has sold ladies' clothing items from her home for a while now. It was challenging, at first, to make her business known. But with the word-of-mouth of friends and neighbors, she has managed to gain new customers. 

Now Nadera would like to buy new fashionable clothing items to increase her profits and offer more variety in what she sells. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy new fashionable clothing items.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 32-year-old mother of four children. While her husband does some vocational work, Hiyam stays at home and sells blankets to earn another source of income. Now she is working on increasing the quantity of items she has to sell. She would like to offer more bed covers in different sizes and styles. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid, who is 24 years old, is from Ramallah. He has been working in a shop where he sells mobile phones for the past six years. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy tables and computers so he can open his own internet cafe business.

Zaid hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and provide his wife with a better life.

Ryada's start-up loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest his own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three-month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy tables and computers so he can open his own internet cafe business.

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en: Arwa is a 31-year-old married lady and the mother for four kids. She has a makeup, accessories and perfumes shop located in a good place. She is now applying for a loan to increase the quantity of goods she has in the shop by getting new types of gift packages.

loans.use: to get new types of gift packages.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa is a 24-year-old married young lady and the mother of three kids. She works in a farming business to help her husband support their family. She also sells blankets from home to bring another income into the family. She now wants to support her home business and buy more bed covers, so for that she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers.

loans.name: Moath

texts.en: Moath is a 26-year-old from Gaza. He owns a small farm on which he has raised and sold livestock since Jan 2011. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to build a stockade for the animals he owns. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the number of livestock and thus improve his sales and financial income.

loans.use: to build a stockade for the animals he owns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small automobile and an electronic scale to increase his charcoal sales.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 42-year-old father of three sons and one daughter. He has a car parts and mechanic shop from which he is supporting his family. He is now applying for a loan to enhance his business and bring more car parts to the shop.

loans.use: to buy more car parts.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 23-year-old from Gaza. He has owned an internet cafe since 2011 and has one employee. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy new computers and a play station for his internet cafe. He hopes that this loan will increase his customers and thus improve his income to help him save money to get married.

loans.use: to buy new computers and a play station for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 38-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to appear in the photo instead.

Layla is the mother of six sons and daughters. Her husband is a driver. Having to support their big family is a lot of financial pressure on the father, and for that Layla is applying for this educational loan to pay her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 25-year-old single guy. He has three brothers and one sister and he is the youngest among them. Ahmad is a university student majoring in chemical engineering. He is applying for this educational loan to pay his next semester registration fees to get his Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay his next semester registration fees.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 47-year-old conservative married woman, so one of her sons, Saleh, appears in the photo instead.
 
Saleh has three siblings. He works in a mall to cover his daily expenses. At the same time he goes to the university to study accounting. Now Sanaa has applied for this loan to pay her son’s semester fees to support him in his studies.

loans.use: to pay her son’s semester fees.

loans.name: Atiyah

texts.en: Atiyah is a 37-year-old father of two boys and one girl. He has a blocks and marble workshop. Atiyah wants to enhance his business by buying a new machine for cutting marble, and for that he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for cutting marble.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 29-year-old who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He studied through primary school. He hired a second-hand motorbike for a transport business to cover his personal expenses. He faces the challenge of increasing his income. He collected a small amount that he intends to use to buy a motorbike. 

He took out a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a new motorbike that can help him to improve his living conditions. He hopes to save more money in order to buy an additional motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike that can help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 34-year-old conservative married woman, so her husband Waleed has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

Hanan is a mother of two boys and one girl. Hanan and her husband work at taking care of sheep and goats to sell. Now Hanan wants to get a loan to expand their herd of sheep and then find a place to rent and build a bigger cattle barn.

loans.use: to expand their herd of sheep

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Niveen is 32 years old and comes from Gaza. She is married. She has owned a grocery store since 2010.

Niveen asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy goods and install shelves to increase the displayed goods in her grocery store. She hopes that this loan will help her assist her husband and improve their income.

loans.use: to buy goods and install shelves to increase the displayed goods in her grocery store.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a 41-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her son to appear in the photo instead.

Khitam has five sons and daughters; her oldest is Tareq who is appearing in the photo.  Tareq is a 19-year-old single guy who recently enrolled in a university to get a Bachelor's degree. Khitam is applying for this loan to support her son in his studies and pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to support her son in his studies

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is 27 years old, divorced, and has one child. She is a resident of Busega, an area on the outskirts of the city. She also takes care of her sister’s child, due the death of her sister three years ago. She has the responsibility of paying for his tuition on top of meeting all her other needs. Kellen started her own business because she could not afford tuition to continue her university studies, and could not find a job to support herself. She has hopes of expanding her business into wholesale so as to increase her income and also complete her house.
Her dream is to finish her house, but she can not save the money all at one go. This is the reason she needs the loan of 4,000,000 shillings. She will be able to live in it with her son and the dependent, therefore she will reduce her rental expenditure which is costly in the city. 
It is because of this challenge that she wants to be funded. In order to complete her house, it needs to be roofed and furnished. She will use profits from the business to repay the loan.
Her neighbours recommend her for being a hardworking, determined and supportive person in society at such her tender age.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her residential house

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 56 años de edad y es  casada por lo tanto tiene cinco hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la  venta de verduras como cebollas,  perejil, tomates, zanahorias, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras.
texts.en: Clara is 56 years old, is married and has five children.  She was born in the city of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and lives in the same city where she was born.  Her main economic activity is the sale of vegetables such as onions, parsley, tomatoes, carrots, corn and other things.  She has already dedicated several years to the business and it is going very well for her thanks to the great effort that she puts into her work.  She belongs to the communal bank “Reyna de los Angeles” and on this occasion she is requesting the loan to purchase vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Exi Maritza

texts.es:
Exi  Maritza, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Ella, se dedica a la agricultura hace 3 años cultiva café, el cual comercializa en el mercado local. El precio de este producto es rentable y de allí ha podido sacar los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 5,000 lempiras, el cual utilizara para la compra de fertilizante y darle asistencia necesaria a su finca. Espera mejorar sus cultivos y ofrecer calidad de producto a los clientes.Su meta es seguir obteniendo ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Exi Maritz, age 28, is married and has two children.  She lives in the Taulabe municipality in Comayagua.

She has been growing coffee for three years, and she sells it at the local market.  The price of this product is profitable, and from this she has been able to get income in order to help her family.

She is requesting her third loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She will use it to buy fertilizer and to provide the necessary care to her farm.

She hopes to improve her crops and to offer a quality product to her customers.  Her goal is to continue getting income in order to help her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to provide the necessary care to her farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is aged 50 years. She is divorced from her husband, and she has five children whom she looks after; all of them attend school. Josephine operates a restaurant in Kagadi town, a business she has been operating since 1998 as a major source of income to look after the family. This business is operated in a rented building which is a big cost to Josephine compared to the income she generates.

Josephine wants a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings to complete construction of her house. This will help her reduce her expenses more in terms of rent. Her dream is to educate the children up to higher institutions of learning and also having a decent living environment for the family. Her challenge is the limited capital in the business and the price fluctuations in the market, which affect her business.

loans.use: To complete construction of her residential house.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 39-year-old married woman; her husband is a vocational worker. Hanan works at selling clothes to make more income. Now Hanan is applying for a loan to bring in a new spring collection of clothes to increase her profits.

loans.use: to bring in a new spring collection

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is 25 years old, a single man; his educational background is bachelor's degree and he lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is hard-working and determined and does not fear challenges. 

Hadi has been operating a bookshop. He began this business three years ago, using some of his own capital. Currently, his store has a small quantity of products on the shelves, but he does not have sufficient money to purchase more items from his suppliers. He took out a youth loan of 160,000 YER from AMB that will enable him to buy stationery products to stock his business. He hopes that with the purchase of these products his store will have a larger quantity of items to be able to meet his customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy stationery products to stock his business.

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.es: Yaquelin tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la  venta de comestibles pues tiene una pequeña tienda donde expende sus productos a diferentes personas. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como fideos, leche, aceite, arroz y azúcar.
texts.en: Yaquelin is 29 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has one child.  She was born in the city of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and she lives in the same city where she was born.  Her principal economic activity is the sale of comestibles as she has a small store where she sells her products to different people.  She has already dedicated several years to the business and it is going very well for her thanks to the great effort that she puts into her work.  She belongs to the communal bank “Reyna de los Angeles” and on this occasion she is requesting the loan to purchase comestibles like noodles, milk, oil, rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy comestibles like noodles, milk, oil, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is a 34-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He works as a shopkeeper. Jean de Dieu started selling lights in January 2013 and to date has sold 40 lights, providing clean energy to 200 people.

Jean de Dieu is requesting a 50 USD loan to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights to resell to people in his village without electricity. Every week or so, his customers will return to have their lights recharged for just 20 cents. Jean de Dieu will reinvest the profit from his loan into his shop to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en: Nariman is a 35-year-old woman. Her husband works in a blacksmith's workshop. They have eight sons and daughters. Nariman works in tailoring at home to get more income for the family. She is applying for this loan to buy more thread and new sewing tools.

loans.use: to buy more thread and new sewing tools.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Don Félix tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en El Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
El señor Félix se dedica desde hace 25 años a la agricultura, específicamente al  cultivo del café. El café lo vende en pergamino en el mercado local, este negocio le es rentable, el precio del café se mantiene y le da los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia.
Esta solicitando el cuarto préstamo de 10,000 lempiras que lo invertirá para comprar fertilizante, abono, limpia  y siembra de café. Con esta inversión ayudara a mantener sus cultivos con buena asistencia  libres de toda plaga. Así podrá seguir vendiendo y ofreciendo el café de buena calidad.
Su meta es mantener la finca de café en buen estado y mantener una buena producción en las cosechas.
texts.en:
Don Félix is 49 years old, is married, has 6 children and lives in the municipality of Taulabe, Comayagua.  Félix has worked for 25 years in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee.  He sells the coffee in parchment in the local market.  This business is profitable for him.  The price of coffee is steady and gives him the necessary income to support his family.  

He is requesting a fourth loan of 10,000 lempiras (HNL) that he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer and manure, in the clearing of the land and in planting coffee.  This investment will help to maintain his crops with good assistance and keep them free of all pests.  Thus he will be able to continue selling and offering good quality coffee.  

His goal is to keep the coffee farm in good condition and maintain a good production in the harvests.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and manure and to pay for clearing the land and planting coffee.

loans.name: Rasmiyeh

texts.en:
Rasmia is a 39-year-old woman. She established a small shop in her house where she sells used shoes. 

Rasmia is requesting a loan to start selling used clothing as well to have variety in her business.

loans.use: to start selling used clothes

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is a 35-year-old man from the Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He lives in an adobe brick home with his wife Console and his five children Diane, Pascal, Tharcise, Annee Marie, and Moise. Francois started selling rechargeable lights in July 2012 and to date has sold 20 lights, providing clean energy to 100 people.

Francois is requesting a 50 USD loan to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights to resell to people in his village without electricity. Every week or so, his customers will return to have their lights recharged for just 20 cents. Francois will use the profit from selling and recharging lights to improve his adobe brick home.

loans.use: to buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Bacilisa

texts.es: Bacilisa tiene 47 años de edad y es casada de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la  venta de comestibles pues tiene una pequeña tienda donde expende sus productos a diferentes personas. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como fideos, leche, aceite, arroz y azúcar.
texts.en: Bacilisa, 47, is married and has three children. She was born in the city of Urubamba, Urubamba province, where she still lives. Her main activity is food sales; she has a little store where she sells her products to different people. Bacilisa has been doing this for some years now and she does well thanks to her commitment. She is a member of the communal bank “Reyna de los Ángeles” and this time she is requesting a loan to buy food supplies, such as noodles, milk, oil, rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy noodles, milk, oil, rice, sugar and other supplies for her store.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y tiene 47 años de edad, casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 5 hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras como por ejemplo  zanahorias, tomates y lechugas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras. Agradece la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Eulogia belongs to the Reyna de los Angeles communal bank.  She is married, and they have five children.

Her main business activity is selling vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, and lettuce.

She now needs a loan to buy vegetables.  She is grateful for the opportunity given to her, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Asma Group

texts.en:
Asma is a 40 years old, a hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and three daughters. Her husband is a government employee but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. All of her daughters are studying in government schools.

 Asma is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2006 she has been operating her own beauty salon. Her daughter is also a beautician and helps her mother in the business. Currently the beauty stock of the salon is almost used up, therefore Asma wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. 

For that reason, as a member of 6-person borrowing group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, make-up kits, hair colors and some other varieties of products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. With the profit she will extend her business by opening one more beauty salon. She dreams to live a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. 

Note: In the picture Asma is the one raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase products for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for embroidery business

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 30-year-old single man who lives with a relative in Taiz, Yemen. He has completed his bachelors degree. Majd works hard and does his best to provide himself with food and clothing. 

Majd is requesting a youth loan of 195,000 YER to buy an appliance for his house. Unfortunately, the money he makes is really not enough to cover this. In the future, Majd hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy an appliance for his house

loans.name: Shameem Group

texts.en:
Shameem, pictured raising her hand, is a 45-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and four children. Her husband has a welding shop, and one of her sons is a taxi driver. They are living in a rented house, and it's very difficult for them to pay their rent. 

Shameem is a beautician by profession. Since 2009, she has been operating her own beauty salon. Currently, the salon is almost out of beauty supplies; therefore, Shameem wants to purchase new cosmetic products to continue her business. 

As a member of a six-person lending group, Shameem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors, and other products. She would also like to buy some new chairs for her salon. With the profit, she would repay the loan and save to build a home with her husband. Shameem is very hopeful that the loan will be productive for them, and she is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para compra cuyes y gallinas. Agradece la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Judith belongs to the "Reyna de los Angeles" (Queen of Angels) communal bank and her principal economic acivity is raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy more guinea pigs and hens.

She is grateful for the offered opportunity and she promises to comply with payment of her different quotas at their scheduled times.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs and to be able to save.

loans.name: Mukhtiar Group

texts.en:
Mukhtiar, pictured raising her hand, is a 35-year-old hardworking woman living with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is deceased, and its very difficult for her to manage the household expenses. She is running a small general store, and she needs additional capital for the growth of her business. 

As a member of seven-person group, Mukhtiar has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to buy a variety of goods and grocery items like rice, sugar, cereals, and milk and introduce some new products in her general store. She wants to spend the profit on the education of her children, and she is looking forward to a better future for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her general store.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 31-year-old university student who is majoring in Arabic Language. Because of financial difficulties, he took a while at the university.

Hamzeh is requesting an educational loan to help him finish his studies and pay for his last year's registration fees.

loans.use: pay for registration fees

loans.name: Genil

texts.en:
Genil is 28 years old and married with three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past three years, Genil has owned a retail business in his local community and he earns 3,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010.

Genil is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to sell such as coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, and noodles. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, and noodles

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a snack food-selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura continua al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la cual expende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y  leche entre otros productos. Laura en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería y surtir su comercio. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Laura continues with the communal bank "Reyna de los Angeles" in the province of Urabamba in Cusco, Peru.  She has a grocery store in which she dispenses products in high demand like rice, sugar, noodles and milk among other produts.  Laura is taking this opportunity to invest the requested loan to buy merchandise and supply her business.  The member is thankful for the loan and promises to complete the payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to by rice, sugar, noodles and milk among other products

loans.name: Rukhsana Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana, pictured raising her hand, is a 35-year-old hardworking woman living with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a laborer, and his income is insufficient to meet their household expenses. Rukhsana runs a small general store, and she needs additional capital for the growth of her business. 

As a member of five-person group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to buy variety of grocery items like rice, sugar, and cereals and introduce some new products in her general store to satisfy her clients' needs. She wants to increase her monthly income and savings for the better future of her children. She would reinvest the profit in her business, use part of it to pay her household expenses, and spend part on the education of children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Nasreen Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, pictured raising her hand, is a 55-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three sons, and two daughters. Three of her children are currently studying in primary school. Nasreen’s husband is a laborer, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Nasreen is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 15 years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

As a member of a seven-person lending group, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently and increase her production. She is currently living in a rented house with her family, and she dreams of building her own house. She also wants to expand her business and to provide a quality education for her children. With the profit she will pay the rent on her house. Nasreen and her family are very thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to stitch  more dresses.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married parent of four children. She works hard to support her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. Josefina also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Josefina is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell at her store

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 76 years old and widowed with 11 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past 10 years, Dominga has owned and operated a food vending business in her local community. She earns 4,000 PHP each month and joined GDMPC in 2007.

Dominga is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products, such as snacks, to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated through her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products such as snacks to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 48-year-old illiterate married woman. During the day, she works as a farmer and in the evenings she sells blankets and snacks from her home. 

Fatmeh is requesting a loan to buy new types of bed covers to sell. She hopes to enhance her business.

loans.use: to purchase bed covers to sell

loans.name: Ghenie

texts.en:
Ghenie is 35 years old, married, and has three children. His wife works abroad while he manages a store for income. 

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, sardines, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell. It will help improve his sales capacity and income, as well. 

Ghenie hopes to keep achieving a good income for his children's education and to achieve better employment, someday. He hopes his wife will not be working abroad anymore.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sardines, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh, is a 29-year-old, hard-working lady. She works in a university, as a cleaner. Her husband is a farmer and they have their own nursery houses that she wants to expand. For that, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to expand their nursery houses and plant new seeds.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, es natural de Urubamba, tiene 51 años, tiene cuatro hijos (Marlene, Edgar, Laura y Daniela), ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Victoria se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella nos cuenta que los días lunes, miércoles y sábados viaja a la ciudad del Cusco llevando sus productos para venderlos en uno de los mercado de la misma ciudad. Ya son 32 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas como por ejemplo de flor, repollo, lechuga, sapallo, etc. La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) communal bank. She is a native of Urubamba, is 51 years old, and has 4 children (Marlene, Edgar, Laura and Daniela). Victoria is a responsible mother who at each moment is searching for opportunities to advance, and through her daily efforts, to provide a better future for her children.

Victoria sells vegetables. She tells us that on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays she travels to the city of Cusco, transporting her products to sell in one of the city's markets. She has dedicated herself to this business for 32 years, and it has gone well, thanks to the effort she puts into the business.

Victoria needs the present loan for purchasing seeds to plant, including for example, flowers, cabbage, lettuce, pumpkins, etc.  She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and, at the same time, Victoria promises to comply with all scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant such as flower, cabbage, pumpkin, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Fruto Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Alma mujer de 25 años de edad casada, con tres hijos menores de edad de 2, 4 y 2 años respectivamente, tiene 4 años de tener su negocio de una pulpería y venta de frijoles cocidos anteriormente trabajaba como operaria en zonas francas poco a poco fue  reuniendo dinero de su pago hasta que formo su pulpería y está cerca en el  cuido de sus hijos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, carne de res, carne de pollo, bisuterías, medicamentos populares, cosméticos como perfumen de varón, perfumen de mujer, lociones etc. Hellen mujer de 31 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la zermat, Avon venta de ropa variada como camisas, chores, pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer etc. y Arli tiene 37 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de fritanga todos los días en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members. One of them is a 25-year-old woman named Alma. She is married and has three young children (a four-year-old and two two-year-olds). Alma has a grocery business and also sells cooked beans. She previously worked in the Free Trade Zone as an operator and gradually saved up her money until she was able to open her store. This enabled her to be near her children so that she could look after them. Her loan will be invested in basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, trinkets, popular medicines, cosmetics, men’s colognes, women’s perfumes, lotions, and other items.

Hellen is a 31-year-old woman who has a business of selling Zermat and Avon cosmetics. She also sells various clothing such as shirts, shorts, men’s trousers, women’s trousers, and other items.

Arli is 37 years old and has a business selling fried foods every day from her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, beef, chicken, trinkets, popular medicines, cosmetics, men’s colognes, women’s perfumes, lotions, and other items.

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Mr. Nergui, 59, lives with his wife and two stepchildren in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His wife has retired from work and now gets a state pension. She also makes and sells clothes on order for vendors and some enterprises. Mr. Nergui's stepson works as a watchman and renders taxi service to local people on his day off. His stepdaughter works as a cook at a restaurant. Mr. Nergui himself has been providing taxi services to local people since 2008 and has accumulated a lot of experience. Before providing taxi services, he worked transporting goods between districts. 

The automobile Mr. Nergui's stepson uses for taxi services has not been paid off. Mr. Nergui is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to pay the remaining automobile costs. When the last payment is posted to the automobile seller's account, the automobile will be Mr. Nergui's stepson's asset. Mr. Nergui is a very hardworking individual who, despite his age, is working hard to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay remaining automobile fee

loans.name: Olman Josue

texts.es:
Olman, tiene 27 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
La zona donde vive Olman es apta para la agricultura, tiene una finca de café que comercializa en pergamino en el mercado local. Esta actividad le ha proporcionado cubrir las necesidades de su familia, el precio del café se mantiene y es rentable.
El esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 15,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante y darle mantenimiento a la finca, mantenerla libre de toda plaga, para que sus cosechas sean de buena calidad y vender a buen precio.
Piensa seguir trabajando con los préstamos para tener el capital para darle la asistencia necesaria  a su finca.
texts.en:
Olman is 27 years old, and is married with two children. He lives in the municipality of Taulabe, in the zone of Comayagua, a region which is known for its farming and agriculture. Olman makes a living as a coffee farmer, and he sells his produce in the local market. His farming operation is his family's only  source of income, and Olman is grateful that the price of coffee remains fairly consistent and can help him to support his family. 

With the support from this loan, Olman plans to purchase fertilizers for use in cultivating and tending his coffee plants. He hopes that this investment will help him to keep his plants free from pests and diseases and will lead to full, healthy harvests of coffee beans that will fetch a good price in the markets. Olman plans to continue with his farming operation and with micro loans as a complement to his own efforts.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for cultivating his coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is 55 years old and has two children. She is a widow and sells fruits, vegetables, and fish for income. She had been in the business for three years and earns about 2,000 PHP each month. She hopes to keep earning good income for her family, which is why she hopes to diversify her business for better profits. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and eggplants to sell. Additional revenue will be invested in school expenses.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is a 24-year-old married lady with one daughter. Besides being a mother, Bayan is also a university student majoring in Physics. After graduation, she wants to look for a job as a teacher. Now Bayan is applying for an educational loan to pay the rest of her semester registration fees.

loans.use: to pay the rest of her semester registration fees.

loans.name: Ghaith

texts.en: Gaith is a 25-year-old single man, living with his five siblings and his parents. Gaith is a university student. He used his previous loan for education and is applying for another one for the same purpose. He will use the loan to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay his school fees.

loans.name: Margelita

texts.en:
Margelita is 46 years old and married with six children.

Margelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She also earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables.

She has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Margelita aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Chincheros y vive en la ciudad de Urquillos de la provincia de Urubamba. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de verduras y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.
texts.en:
Florencia is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She was born in the city of Chicheros, but currently lives in Urquillos in Urubamba Province. Her main business activity is selling vegetables, but she also raises small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has been in business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Florencia is a member of the Communal Bank “Reyna de Los Angeles”. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: G.s Los Prados#2 Group

texts.es:
El Señor Luis es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposa y sus   hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca,  al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es compra y venta  de granos desde hace más de 9 años. 
Don Luis préstamo lo necesita para la compra de granos maíz. Con el crédito espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan  y así cubrir sus necesidades.
Don Luis al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan que con la inversión que realicen a sus negocios su situación económica mejore un poco. En unos años esperan ver sus negocios  posicionados  como los más reconocidos de la zona.
Don Luis espera poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.
Don Moisés su negocio es  compra  y venta  de granos  básicos desde hace 5 años. 
Doña Mayra  su negocio es la  venta  de  ropa  usada desde hace 5 años.




Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero  del 2013
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is an enterprising person who lives with his wife and children in a community of Choluteca, which is in southern Honduras. He has been in the business of buying and selling grain for more than nine years.

Don Luis needs a loan so that he can buy corn kernels. With this loan, he hopes to increase his sales since he will have additional capital by which to acquire fresh product to offer to his customers. As a result, he will be able to fulfill their needs.

Don Luis and his fellow group members hope that this investment in their businesses will gradually improve their economic situation. In a few years, they hope to see their businesses positioned among the most well-known in the area. Don Luis hopes to continue supporting his children so that they will become outstanding members of society and have better opportunities.

Don Moisés has been buying and selling basic grains for five years. Doña Mayra has been selling used clothing for five years.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy corn kernels to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Rolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Rolita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Ma. Rolita is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Ma. Rolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 38-year-old conservative woman. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Basma is the mother of four daughters. She and her family established a small coffee booth where her husband is currently working to support the family. Now Basma is applying for a loan to add new types of hot drinks to the menu.

loans.use: to add new types of hot drinks to her family's coffee stand menu.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 47-year-old widow. She is supporting her six sons and daughters by herself by selling clothing items from home. She applied for this loan to increase the quantity and the variety of her products and improve her profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is a 32-year-old mother of three children. She is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in her loan request photo. 

Haya’s husband sells carpets, while she sells home products from home. Haya applied for this loan to increase the quantity of home products she has to sell in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of home products she sells.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of four sons and one daughter. Mona has a home products shop that she wants to expand by renting the shop opposite hers. She applied for this loan to increase the quantity she has of products so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of products she has for sale.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 58-year-old illiterate woman. After her husband passed away, she was left to raise three sons and a daughter. Her youngest is now 14 years old. To be able to support the family, Fatmeh sells clothes and blankets from home to neighbors and their friends. Now Fatmeh is applying for another loan to buy more bed covers to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some clothes hanging equipment and new fashionable clothes

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en: Lynie is 46 years old and married with five children - three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lynie has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19500 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Lynie would like to save enough money to buy a vehicle to use for her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoudah

texts.en:
Mahmoudah is a 34-year-old illiterate woman. She and her husband are both farmers. After the workday is done, Mahmoudah goes back home to take care of her two sons. She also sells blankets at home to make additional income. 

Mahmoudah is working on enhancing her business, so she applied for this loan to purchase more bed covers in different sizes.

loans.use: to purchase more bed covers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years old and has eight children. She has been widowed for one year. She carries the burden of supporting her family's needs alone. Four of her children are still in school. 

Janet earns about 5,000 PHP each month from the retail store she operates. Her income goes for school fees and reinvesting in the business. 

Janet hopes to improve her sales, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, softdrinks, eggs, and noodles to sell. Additional revenue will be reserved for school expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, softdrinks, eggs, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is 41 and the mother of two boys and a girl. She is a conservative woman, so Faten asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Faten's husband has a medium-sized food market with which he supports the family. Faten is applying for this loan to help her husband enhance the variety of goods he sells at the store.

loans.use: to add more variety to the products her husband sells.

loans.name: Shamsa

texts.en: Shamsa is a 52-year-old mother of seven children. Her husband is a bus driver while she sells blankets and home products at her house. She is applying for this loan to increase her profits by buying more home products to sell. That will help in supporting her family and expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling lechon (roasted pig) in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Maricel is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her lechon.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her lechon (roasted pig).

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a retail store owner from Solana. She is 29 years old and married to a carpenter. They have two children. She sells grocery items and vegetables to the people in her village. She usually earns PHP 5,000 each month which goes toward meals, education expenses and revolving capital in the business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs and bread to sell. 

Someday, Jocelyn hopes to achieve better profits for her children's education and someday lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs and bread to sell

loans.name: Moawiah

texts.en: Moawiah is a 31 years old and single. He has three siblings and they live with their parents. Moawiah works in a governmental entity during the day and after that he goes to his shop where he sells tissues, baby paper goods and some cleaning products. Now, he is applying for this loan to increase the quantity and variety of goods to sell to increase his profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity and variety of goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 32-year-old married man. He is the father to two daughters. His wife works with the civil defense department and he works in the Ministry of Education. After that he goes to work on his land where he has built a nursery area for plants. Ahmad is applying for a loan to get more seeds and some tools for farming.

loans.use: to get more seeds and some tools for farming.

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en: Sabha is a 46-year-old divorcée who has established a home printing house at her home. She uses simple tools to print cards and some advertising material. She applied for this loan to get more material for her work in order to produce larger quantities at fewer prices.

loans.use: to get material for her work.

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en: Fedaa is a 30-year-old conservative woman who asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. She is the mother to 5 children. She takes care of them and works in their home-based food store where she sells candy and other food products. She is now applying for a youth loan to bring new types of food products to her store.

loans.use: to bring new type of food products to her store to sell.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 25 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children and her mother in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. 

Chan requests a loan of $300 to hire bulldozer to smooth her land for building a new house. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to make more income for the family.

loans.use: to hire a bulldozer to smooth her land for building a new house.

loans.name: Srey Neath

texts.en:
Srey Neath is 19 years old. She is a first-year university student, who lives with her parents in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is a second daughter in the family. She graduated from high school in 2012.

Since she has an extensive family, which has seven members, her parents cannot provide enough support for their children. Therefore, Srey Neath requests a loan of $3050 to pay for her tuition fee. This money will help her to obtain enough financial resources to pursue her university studies. In the future, she hopes to get a good job as a banker, in a financial institution in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay her tuition and fees

loans.name: Fulgencia

texts.en:
Fulgencia is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost three years ago for a loan to expand her business. She is receiving her 6th loan and will use it for her home's improvement. She is running a business where she sells underwear. She lives in a rural area in the Puerto Plata.

Fulgencia is the mother of two children, one of whom lives with her and her long term partner. Because they are living in deteriorated housing, she is requesting a loan which she will use to improve her situation by purchasing building materials to finish her house.
